contentList.content: Inevitable Advance

Spend an action to gain <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SPELLBREAKER_INEVITABLE_ADVANCE">Inevitable Advance</LSTag> for 10 turns, allowing you to ignore <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="DIFFICULT_TERRAIN">Difficult Terrain</LSTag> and the enemy's attempts to move you.
You cannot be forcibly moved by a foe's spells or actions, and you ignore the effects of <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="DIFFICULT_TERRAIN">Difficult Terrain</LSTag>.
Ignore <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="DIFFICULT_TERRAIN">Difficult Terrain</LSTag> and attempts to forcibly move you.
Spell Purge
You gain the ability to cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_DispelEvilAndGood_BreakEnchantment">Dispel Evil and Good: Break Enchantment</LSTag>.
Eyes of the Watcher
You learn how to cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Spellbreaker_Shout_EyesOfTheWatcher_NEW">Eyes of the Watcher</LSTag>.
For 10 turns, no magic can shroud your eyes. You can see normally in both magical and non-magical darkness, you cannot be blinded, and you can see through certain magical illusions.
This ability can be used once per <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag> without spending a Spellbane die. Subsequent uses expend a Spellbane die.

You can see normally in darkness, both magical and non-magical, to a distance of [1], you can't be Blinded. In addition, you can see through illusions and are unaffected by spells that would deceive your eyes.

You are unaffected by Hypnotic Pattern, Phantasmal Force, Phantasmal Killer, and Fear, and your attacks ignore the effects of Mirror Image and Blur.
Deny Magic NEW
Spellbreaker

Spellbreakers stand as steadfast guardians against the arcane, channeling the power of their unique abilities to suppress and counteract magic. They wield both sword and purpose with unwavering conviction.
Spellbane Die
Spellbane dice are spent to empower Spellbreaker abilities, improving anti-magic capabilities in combat.
Spellbane Dice: [3]

Your Spellbane Dice are d4s. You have [3]. At Fighter level 5, these dice become d6s. At Fighter level 9, they become d8s. They fuel your Spellbreaker abilities and are expended upon use. You regain expended Spellbane Dice after a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.
You gain 2 more <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="LyriumDie">Spellbane Dice</LSTag>.
Disciplines
Disciplines are powerful abilities that use Spellbane Dice.
Deny Magic
When an enemy hits you or a nearby ally with a spell, reduce the damage by [1] as a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ReactionActionPoint">reaction</LSTag>. You must be able to see the attacker.
You can toggle off whether Deny Magic triggers for allies.
Deny Magic (Ally)
When an enemy hits an ally within [1] with a spell, spend a spellbane die to reduce the damage by [2]. You must be able to see the attacker.
Annulling Strike

Spend a spellbane die to deal an additional [1] and break the target's <LSTag Tooltip="Concentration">Concentration</LSTag>. On a hit, the target must also succeed on a Constitution <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> or be <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="TEMPLAR_ANNULMENT_ANTIMAGIC">Spell Blocked</LSTag> for 1 turn.
Does not spend a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="SpellbaneDie">spellbane die</LSTag>.
Rite of Annulment
You learn how to cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Spellbreaker_Shout_RiteOfAnnulment_NEW">Rite of Annulment</LSTag>.

For 3 turns, you project an antimagic field around yourself. Creatures within the area are <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="TEMPLAR_ANNULMENT_ANTIMAGIC">Spell Blocked</LSTag>, have advantage on <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> against spells, and are <LSTag Tooltip="Immunity">Immune</LSTag> to damage from spells.

While it remains in the aura, the creature is <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="TEMPLAR_ANNULMENT_ANTIMAGIC">Spell Blocked</LSTag>, has advantage on <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> against spells, and is <LSTag Tooltip="Immunity">Immune</LSTag> to damage from spells.
Spell Blocked
A Spellbreaker has severed the character's connection to magic, preventing it from casting spells.
Spellbreaker's Counterspell
Spend a reaction to make a creature fail when it casts a spell.

Make a creature fail when it casts a spell. Spells of level [1] or lower can always be interrupted. Higher level spells are harder and require a Constitution <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Check</LSTag>. Successfully nullifying a spell has a 50% chance to apply <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="TEMPLAR_ANNULMENT_ANTIMAGIC">Spell Block</LSTag> to the caster for 1 turn.
Counterspell DC is equal to 12 + the spell's level.
Spend a spellbane die to give an ally a +[1] bonus on an Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> against a spell.

Break your target's <LSTag Tooltip="Concentration">Concentration</LSTag> and <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SILENCED">Silence</LSTag> it for 2 turns. If your target is concentrating or is a supernatural or otherworldly being, deal the maximum possible damage of [1].
Practiced Doctrine
Spend a spellbane die to gain a +[1] bonus on your next Arcana or Investigation <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Check</LSTag>.
You have a +[1] on your next Arcana or Investigation <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Check</LSTag>.
Mental Fortress
When you make an Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> against a spell, you can spend a spellbane die to add +[1] to the roll.
Sacred Chant
Invoke ancient hymns to harness powerful effects. Each chant is a <LSTag Tooltip="Concentration">Concentration</LSTag> ability that offers unique benefits.
Being <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SILENCED">Silenced</LSTag> will prevent you from chanting. However, chants are not spells and are not affected by antimagic effects like Sussur.
You have a +[1] bonus to Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> against spells for 10 turns.
Gain a +[1] bonus on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> against spells for 10 turns.

As a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ReactionActionPoint">reaction</LSTag>, when an ally makes an Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> against a spell, grant them a +[1] bonus.

Make a weapon attack that deals an additional [1], breaks your target's <LSTag Tooltip="Concentration">Concentration</LSTag>, and <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SILENCED">Silence</LSTag> it for 2 turns. If your target is concentrating or is a supernatural or otherworldly being, you deal the maximum possible damage of [2].
Gain a +[1] bonus on Arcana, Religion, and Medicine <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Checks</LSTag> for 10 turns.
Cleanse Magic
Gain the ability to cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Templar_Target_RemoveCurse">Remove Curse</LSTag> with a spellbane die.
Purge Magic
Gain the ability to cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Templar_Target_DispelEvilAndGood_BreakEnchantment">Dispel Evil and Good: Break Enchantment</LSTag> with a Lyrium Die.
Censor Magic

You can spend a spellbane die to use Spellbreaker's Counterspell and nullify another creature's spell as a reaction. The spell must be 2nd Level or lower. If it is higher, you must succeed a Constitution <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Check</LSTag> to nullify it. The difficulty is 12 plus the spell's Level.
Improved Spellbane
The size of your <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="SpellbaneDie">Spellbane Dice</LSTag> increases to 1d6.
"There is No Darkness"
Weave Rend
Spend an action to tear at the weave itself, unleashing a shockwave that <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="TEMPLAR_ANNULMENT_ANTIMAGIC">Spell Blocks</LSTag> all in its path.

Brandish your weapon to tear open the Weave itself and unleash a shockwave of energy that <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="TEMPLAR_ANNULMENT_ANTIMAGIC">Spell Blocks</LSTag> all creatures in its path for 2 turns.
Your weapon burns with incredible heat and deals an additional [1]. This damage scales with the size of your <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="SpellbaneDie">Spellbane dice</LSTag>.
The size of your <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="SpellbaneDie">Spellbane Dice</LSTag> increases to 2d4.
Weaveburning Strike

Ignite your weapon with spell-consuming fire and inflict <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SPELLBREAKER_WEAVEBURN_CURSE">Weave Burn</LSTag> on your target, causing further damage whenever it casts a spell.
Deal an extra [1] and set alight your target's connection to the weave: each time it casts a spell it receives [2] per spell level.
Weave Burn
Each time the creature casts a spell it receives [1] per spell level.
The creature received [1] for casting a level [2] spell while it has <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SPELLBREAKER_WEAVEBURN_CURSE">Weave Burn</LSTag>.
Antimagic Acolyte

You learn one basic Discipline from the Spellbreaker subclass and gain two <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="SpellbaneDie">Spellbane Dice</LSTag> to fuel it. You regain expended Spellbane Dice after a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.
